intro: Coccocypselum brevipetiolatum, commonly known as the short-petioled coccocypselum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, palmate leaves with short petioles and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to dry conditions with its succulent-like leaves. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in local pollination networks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
